mods.abstract: TEN DOLLARS REWARD--Ran away from the undersigned on the 11th inst., the black slave girl SARAH. Said slave is about 24 years of age, 5 feet 4 inches high; has a scar on the right side of her neck, approaching the jaw bone, and has a sleepy cast of the eyes when looked at or spoken to. Captains and clerks of steamboats are requested to look out, as she will probably leave for some up country port; and the public are cautioned against harboring her, for if found in their possession they will be prosecuted to the utmost extent of the law. Any person apprehending, or giving such information as to lead to her recovery, will receive the above reward. MRS. MILLER, 96 Rampart st. ja17 3t*
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
